Event:
The author is experiencing a range of negative emotions, including sadness, hopelessness, frustration, anger, and helplessness. They are feeling overwhelmed by the state of the world and the mistreatment of various groups of people, including those based on their race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, and more. They express a sense of despair and powerlessness in the face of these injustices, and feel that society is flawed and corrupt.

The author also mentions personal struggles with self-awareness and self-improvement, as well as feelings of inadequacy and low self-esteem. They express a desire to continue living despite their negative emotions and to find ways to improve themselves and the world around them.

Overall, the author's emotional state is one of sadness, frustration, and helplessness, but also of determination and resilience in the face of adversity.
Post: "I can't believe how messed up the world is. It seems like every day there's a new injustice, a new group of people being mistreated. I feel so helpless, like there's nothing I can do to stop it. I'm just one person, what can I do? It's like society is fundamentally flawed and corrupt. I'm not sure how much more of this I can take. Sometimes I just want to give up and hide from the world. But at the same time, I know I can't. I have to keep going, for myself and for the people who need me. I may not be able to change the world on my own, but maybe I can make a difference in some small way. Maybe I can help someone feel less alone, or inspire them to take action themselves. It's all I can do, but it's something at least. #feelingoverwhelmed #despair #powerlessness"

Event:
The post describes a series of symptoms and medical conditions, including:

* Post orgasmic illness syndrome (POIS)
* Acqured acalculia (inability to perform simple mathematical tasks)
* Agoraphobia (fear of places or situations that might cause panic)
* Akathisia (movement disorder characterized by feeling restless and unable to stay still)
* Alexia (inability to recognize or read written words or letters)
* Amusia (inability to recognize musical tones or reproduce them)
* Anhedonia (inability to feel pleasure in normally pleasurable activities)
* Anomia (inability to recall the names of everyday objects)
* Anosognosia (inability or refusal to recognize a defect or disorder that is clinically evident)
* Apathy (lack of emotion or motivation)
* Deliberate self-harm and drug overdose
* Depression (state of feeling unhappy and without hope for the future)
* Dysarthria (difficult or unclear articulation of speech)
* Dysdiadochokinesia (impairment of rapid, alternating movements)
* Dystonia (abnormal muscle tone resulting in muscular spasm and abnormal posture)
* Euphoria (state of intense excitement and happiness)
* Hallucination (perceiving things that are not actually there)
* Headache (pain in the head or neck)
* Homicidal ideation (thoughts of committing homicide)
* Hypothermia (condition of having an abnormally low body temperature)
* Hyperthermia (condition of having a body temperature greatly above normal)
* Insomnia (inability to sleep at night)
* Mania (excessive enthusiasm or desire)
* Paralysis (loss of muscle function in part or all of the body)
* Paranoia or persecution (irrational fear of being persecuted or harmed)
* Phobia (irrational fear of a specific object, situation, or activity)
* Pyrexia (raised body temperature)
* Sciatica (pain in the back, hip, and outer side of the leg)
* Somnolence (state of feeling drowsy or ready to fall asleep)
* Tic (involuntary movement or muscle twitching)
* Tremor (involuntary quivering movement)
* Weight gain/loss (increase or decrease in body weight)

The post describes a wide range of symptoms and medical conditions, which could be indicative of various mental and physical health issues.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless. I've been experiencing POIS, acquired acalculia, agoraphobia, akathisia, alexia, amusia, anhedonia, anomia, anosognosia, apathy, and delusional thinking. I've also been struggling with deliberate self-harm and drug overdose. I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. My depression is taking over my life, and I'm struggling to find any joy or purpose. My speech is slurred, and I have difficulty articulating my thoughts. My movements are slow and uncoordinated, and I feel like I'm constantly in a state of confusion. I've also been experiencing hallucinations and euphoria, which is making it hard for me to distinguish between what's real and what's not. My headaches are constant, and I can't seem to shake off this feeling of hopelessness. I'm afraid I might harm myself or others. Please help me."

I'm trying to put on a brave face and act like everything is fine, but it's not easy."

Event: The person experienced feelings of disappointment and frustration due to the inconsistent behavior of their classmates. They were friendly towards them in class but not outside of it, and they didn't keep in touch or show any interest in maintaining a friendship.
Post: "I'm starting to think that people are just inherently unreliable and insincere. I tried to make friends with my classmates, but they only pretended to be interested in me when we were in class together. Outside of class, they couldn't care less about me or maintaining any kind of relationship. It's like they're all just actors playing a role, and as soon as the bell rings, they drop the act and move on with their lives without a second thought about the people they leave behind. It's really disappointing and frustrating to realize that even the people I thought were my friends are just using me for their own benefit."

Event: ... (main event) - It sucks because a flaw about your personality can easily be fixed and I doubt it has a strong impact. Being reminded constantly of body flaws is the worst in my opinion because that can just ruin someone completely. It just hits you in the heart because that's what everyone views you as. What sucks even more is that, you can be confident in your own skin and as soon as someone points out a flaw, that thought stays with you forever and will never escape your mind. All these insecurities build up and it's just horrible.
Post: "I hate my body, I feel like I'm constantly being judged because of my flaws. It's like everyone is just waiting for me to fail so they can say 'I told you so'. Even if I try to be confident, one comment from someone can ruin everything. It's like my insecurities are a constant weight that I can't shake off. Why can't people just see past my appearance and see the real me? It's like I'm doomed to be unhappy forever."

Event: The author expresses frustration with the hypocrisy and pretentiousness of individuals in their statements about caring about others and treating them with respect, while actually being selfish and egotistical.
Post: "I'm so done with people who claim to care about others but only look out for themselves. They pretend to be all about love and respect, but in reality, they're just selfish and egotistical. It's like, hello, can't you see how hypocritical you're being? It's like, you say one thing but do the complete opposite. It's so frustrating! I mean, if you truly cared about others, you'd actually put in the effort to listen and understand their perspectives, instead of just talking over them and making it all about you. But no, instead, we get people who are more concerned with appearances than actual substance. It's like, what's the point of saying you care if you don't actually show it? #hypocrisy #selfishness #egotism"
